title: Feature request: identify cycles in undirected graph

content.raw:
This is split out from #82, as one of the steps in determining whether a DirectedGraph is a DirectedTree. If a graph represents the kinematics of a multibody system, it is helpful to know if there are cycles in the graph, which represent kinematic loops. Some simulators need to take special steps in order handle models with loops.

This [stackoverflow post](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/526331/cycles-in-an-undirected-graph/532951#532951) suggests that a depth-first search can be used to identify cycles in an undirected graph.
